content.rendered:
Juana Martn presents Andaluca in her first fashion show at Haute Couture in Paris

The Cordoba designer makes her debut in the official calendar of Paris Haute Couture Week with a collection inspired on her land and her culture "Andaluca", a proposal faithful to her flamenco and avant-garde style.

Juana Martn makes history in Spanish fashion. July 7th at 4:00 p.m., the designer was participating in the Paris Haute Couture calendar with her first fashion show as a member of the Fdration Franaise de la Haute Couture et de la Mode (FHCM).

"Andaluca" is a tribute to its land and its culture. With the aim of bringing all the essence of Andaluca to Paris, the designer has once again invited her friend and well-known actress Rossy de Palma and the artists Israel Fernandez and Diego del Morao to musicalize the fashion show. Fernndez has been described by the press as "the most important singer of his generation" and del Morao has accompanied great figures of cante throughout his career on the guitar. Both have been nominated for a Grammy Award in 2022 in the category of Best Flamenco Album for their latest work "Amor".


By Fashion Editor 24FashionTV: Christina V Henningstad
